item.title: Widespread mask use may avert virus waves
item.description: Population-wide face mask use could push COVID-19 transmission down to controllable levels for national epidemics, and could prevent further waves of the pandemic disease when combined with lockdowns, according to a British study.

item.title: Malaysia reopens after 3-month lockdown
item.description: Malaysia has reopened nearly all economic and social activities after a nearly three-month lockdown successfully brought down coronavirus infections.

item.title: UK review of 5G security important: NATO
item.description: The head of the NATO military alliance says the West cannot ignore the rise of China and so it is important the United Kingdom has a review of the role of Huawei in its 5G network to ensure its security.

item.title: Latest snapshot of the coronavirus impact
French virus emergency powers end July 10
item.description: France will end special government powers brought in to deal with the coronavirus pandemic on July 10 but will retain the ability to curb gatherings and freedom of movement for four months, the prime minister's office says.

item.title: Perth man dies from gunshot wound
item.description: A 28-year-old man has died from a gunshot wound after a shooting at a Perth home earlier this week.

item.title: Second BLM protest in Adelaide called off
item.description: Organisers of a second Black Lives Matter rally in Adelaide have cancelled the event but have vowed to return to the streets in the future.

item.title: Royals wish Philip happy 99th birthday
item.description: The royals have congratulated the Duke of Edinburgh on his 99th birthday.

item.title: Man in court over alleged Vic sex assaults
item.description: A man who allegedly sexually assaulted a woman and child in a Melbourne has faced court.

item.title: Error in Colt case led to dropped charges
item.description: The detective leading the abuse investigation into the infamous Colt clan says it was an oversight that alibi evidence placing an accused child rapist in another state was not served until the eve of his trial.
